div1.p: Department of State. Monrovia. September 20th 1886 25 october 1886 1246 Carton 3 Dossier 3

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your Department of the 2nd (forwarded) through our Minister President M le Baron de Stein to this Department, in which you do me the honor to inform me that His Majesty King Leopold II the reign of the independent State of the Congo, has to nominate you as General Administrator of the Department of Foreign Affairs of that state.
His Excellency E. Van Eetvelde General Administrator of the Department of Foreign Affairs of the Independent State of the Congo Brussels Belgium.

pleased to inform me of the desire on your part to established between the two states agreeable relations of friendship which it is hoped will be profitable to them, and alas to assure me that nothing on your part shall be neglected to give them this double character.

3. In reply permit me to assure you Sir of the pleasure it gives this Department to be thus brought into friendly intercourse with the Government of the New African State, and that my Governemtn feliciates itself upon the signal evidence of good regard and friendly feeling on the part of the Governement of the Free State of the Congo (as in your above cited Despatch) toward our Republic. The expression of your good wish and desire for friendly confidence are heartily reciprocated, and I shall take pleasure in endeavoring to give a

practival form to the same. 4. It affords me therefore much pleasure to offer you my congratulations on your nomination to this important position and to add the assurance of the high consideration and esteem with which
